banner-content.openTechnologies: an open technologies robot for education.

c2a2.description: Let's start your journey with us, build your own application using blocks or native Python code.

general_landing.fossbot: FOSSBot is an open source and open design DIY robot that has been developed by Greek Free and Open Source Software (GFOSS) and Harokopio University of Athens (HUA) for educational purposes. The robot does not come alone, but comprises multiple software and system solutions that provide a holistic approach for STEM education at all educational levels.
general_landing.platform: FOSSBot platform is a web-based platform that provides a set of tools for creating, editing, and running programs for the FOSSBot robot. The platform is designed to be user-friendly and to provide a seamless experience for users of all ages and backgrounds.
general_landing.github: You can download the 3D print designs and instructions to create your own FOSSBot. Additionally, you can contribute to the development of the platform by submitting bug reports, feature requests, or code contributions.
general_landing.fossbot_text: The FOSSBot is an affordable, customizable robot, built with low-cost electronics and 3D-printable parts. It uses a Raspberry Pi Zero for internet connectivity and sensor support, enabling tasks like robot control and computer vision. The plastic parts, made from durable PETG filament, house all electronic components securely. Key features include a pencil holder for drawing, side spoilers for wheel protection, and a LEGO-compatible top cover. Electronics include gyroscope, accelerometer, odometers, wheel motors, RGB LED, and various sensors, making it versatile and repairable for under $200. The software stack, running on Raspbian OS, uses Python and supports microservices, Google Blockly, and Python Flask, offering modes for no-coding, block-based coding, and Python programming. This flexibility makes FOSSBot ideal for educational purposes, combining easy assembly with advanced programming capabilities.

card-fossbot.about_blockly: You can create programs for the FOSSBot robot using the Blockly editor. Blockly is a visual programming language that allows users to create programs by dragging and dropping blocks that represent code.
card-fossbot.about_monaco: The Monaco editor is a text-based editor that allows users to write programs for the FOSSBot robot using the Python programming language. The editor provides a real coding experience and is ideal for users who are familiar with text-based programming languages.
card-fossbot.about_simulator: We have developed a simulator that allows users to test their programs for the FOSSBot robot without needing access to the physical robot. The simulator provides a virtual environment where users can run and debug their programs before deploying them to the robot.

hua-banner.haorkopioUniversityDescription: Harokopio University of Athens is a public university dedicated to promoting research and learning in a small, well focused set of intellectual areas. The university, situated in the centre of Athens and close to the Unesco World Heritage Centre of the Acropolis, originates from an educational institution that was first established in 1929 and gained the status of University in 1990. It takes its name from the national benefactor Panagis Harokopos. The University/’s excellent campus facilities houses four academic departments, the central administration, the library, the IT centre and student advisory services. Harokopio University of Athens is located close to many important cultural sites of interest such as the Acropolis Museum, Thissio, Panathenaic Stadium (Kallimarmaron), Keramikos and the Benaki Museum.
